snippet: The central bank cut its benchmark interest rate to 0.15 percent, a record low.
abstract: European Central Bank rolls out groundbreaking package of new measures intended to put Europe on a path to stronger growth, cutting benchmark interest rate to a record low of 0.15 percent; so-called negative interest rate is intended to encourage banks to put their money to work rebuilding the battered euro zone, and to weaken the euro itself, making exports more competitive.

byline.original: By JACK EWING and NEIL IRWIN
byline.contributor: Jack Ewing reported from Frankfurt and Neil Irwin from Washington. Liz Alderman contributed reporting from Athens.

lead_paragraph: The central bank cut its benchmark interest rate to 0.15 percent, a record low.

headline.main: European Central Bank Breaks New Ground to Press Growth
headline.print_headline: European Central Bank Breaks New Ground to Press Growth
